conversations.content: All right, which one of you is Euden? You're in here, aren't you? Come out immediately!
Were you looking for me?
Was I? I'm not certain. Frankly, I expected someone with muscles. Possibly a beard.
Whatever. I'll allow you to hire me on. You're not exactly my type, but I like what I've heard about you.
I'm flattered by the offer, but... who are you?
Are you seriously asking me that? ME?! The greatest magical mind of our time? The genius of the century?
Not ringing any bells, sorry...
Un-be-lievable. Well, let's try this: it's my signature spell! If you don't know it, you've been living under a rock.
Oh, I know that spell! I just don't know you.
Hmm. Still unclear if you're just ignorant or deliberately trolling me.
Never. Now can I please have your name?
I suppose. It's Ezelith. See that you don't forget it.
Oh, and I expect proper treatment here. Just because you're unaware of what a coup hiring me was doesn't change that.
If you're asking for special treatment, I'm afraid I can't offer it—but rest assured everyone here is treated with respect.
Fine, good enough. Oh! You there! Surely YOU know who I am!
Muh? Ya talkin' to me?
I am indeed! My turn to ask a question. Who is the world-famous mage known far and wide for this signature spell?!
Oh, I've seen that magic before! Hmm, where was it...? Oh, right! Old Granny Catlady back home used to use it!
Is EVERYONE in this castle daft?!
It's Ezelith, yeah? That's some pretty impressive work ya been doin' lately. Attitude's a little rough, but hey...
Yes, it turns out that the genius of the century is capable at her job. Any other brilliant observations you'd like to offer?
＂Genius＂ is a convenient title, yeah? No proof required—just get to say it and off ya go.
Just what are you insinuating?! I think I've MORE than proven my genius here!
To yerself, sure—which gets ya as far as ＂self-professed genius.＂ But to be the real deal, ya gotta convince someone else.
A genius is a genius. It's a statement of fact, not something that requires the say-so of another.
Well, ya got mine anyway, so that's a solid start on that next step.
This is quite the turn from the local oaf. You DO acknowledge my genius, then?
Got no reason to lie, do I?
Then put on more of a show of envying me. Stand in jealous awe of my intellect while cursing your own mediocrity!
Bwa ha ha! Back when I was younger, I might'a done just that.
But like I said, yer just barely at the first step here.
Ah, THERE we are! That had the faint ring of sour grapes. Delicious...
I am bored to DEATH of praise. I want to see people writhe!
Eh, it's easy enough to get respect, but givin' it? That's tricky.
Yer own talent and pride can get in the way and keep ya from seein' straight. Hell, yer a classic case of that.
Or perhaps no one else is at my level! Why should I acknowledge a bunch of dullards who can't keep pace with me?
Ain't a matter of ＂should.＂
This is ridiculous. If there's no need for me to acknowledge anyone else as a peer, why would I ever do so?
Sheesh. Got it all figured out, yeah? Ya MUST be a genius, then...
At last, something we agree on!
Yes? What is it? I can only assume you called me down here to lecture me.
Very good. Let's talk about how you comport yourself in combat.
Some occasional grandstanding is benign enough, but your total lack of cooperation is a drain on everyone's morale.
So, what? I should hobble my genius to make nice with others?
This has nothing to do with your genius. I've collected the data. We can review it together once—
Ugh, never MIND! I've heard it all before. This place is as hopeless as the others.
I'm fast arriving at the same conclusion about you. Perhaps it's time we all moved on.
What's that supposed to mean? Are you FIRING me?!
Why would I need to? You won't stay. You certainly didn't at any of the other knightly orders you joined.
The other... You dug up my PAST? Oh, you're a real piece of work, lady!
I don't have to dig to hear rumors.
And you believed them blindly and decided to come needle me so I'd run off. That it?
Oh, believe me, if I were trying to run you off, I wouldn't do so with needling. Ezelith, your talent is exceptional, but—
But what? I refuse to work beneath my full potential just to match pace with all the slack-jawed yokels around here?
BUT you have room to grow even further, is what I was going to say. And as such, I have some new tactics I'd like to explore.
Room to GROW? If I grew any further, there'd be no need for you at all!
And I would gladly welcome the time off. For now, I see potential standing before me, and I want to see it realized.
...You said you heard rumors. About me.
Not a one of them complimentary.
And you believed them.
I believe in what I see with my own eyes— and what I see is budding talent.
Budding... Fine, then! Gimme those tactics! I'll give 'em a thorough review!
You mentioned before that you were curious to experience failure, Ezelith. Any luck so far?
Of course not! ...But I think I at least have a better grasp of the concept now.
What does failure mean to YOU, Euden?
Hmm. I guess it's a feeling of frustration and impasse when all of your talent isn't enough to accomplish your goals.
I'm well aware of the definition, thanks. I meant its PERSONAL significance.
So, the lessons failure teaches a person?
Exactly. You see, as a genius, I doubted I would ever truly know failure.
I've never cared a lick for the expectations of others, and any task I set my mind to can be accomplished with ease.
That certainly sounds like a recipe for a failure-free life.
Right? So the way I see it, the only way I can experience failure is through others.
Everyone around me screwed up and dragged me down, so I came up short— that sort of thing.
I...suppose that still qualifies as failure?
But getting over that would hardly help me grow. Honestly, I think this business about getting stronger with failure is malarkey.
What's more, the people here are all reasonably smart and capable, so there's my last hope of failure out the window.
Anyway, that's when I started thinking of it differently. Like, what if what I did BEFORE finding this place was my stumbling block?
I don't need to worry about future failures now. I can just stay here and be thankful for what I've found.
That's actually a good way to think of it.
I KNOW, right? The ability to think outside the box like that is what defines a genius, you know.
We need to talk, old man. Come.
I'm busy. If yer gonna ask me out, you can do it right here.
Sad. Also, gross. Possibly very gross? This is about combat tactics, you goon.
Still waitin' for the point here.
There's something I'd like to try. It's not especially difficult, but... I can't do it alone.
Look at this diagram. The key lies in you and I tightly coordinating. I call this move ＂The Ranzelith Rampage.＂ Now, it's... Er...
What? Why are you grinning? Is it a creepy old man thing? Don't make me call Cleo!
I'm just thinkin' back to when ya asked why ya'd ever wanna acknowledge anyone else—and look at ya now. I'm so proud!
Ew, don't get all nostalgic on me. That's SUCH an old man move.
Enough with the ＂old man＂ stuff already. I'll help ya out, but only if I get a new nickname.
Well, listen to you! Have one in mind, old man? Let's hear it.
＂Big bro.＂
Okay, what? We're family now? Ew. No.
What's wrong with—
At the point I have to explain that, you are DEFINITELY an old man. So we'll just stick with that.
Anyway, don't act like you're not excited to rampage across the battlefield with me.
I'm always ready to rampage, kid.
Good! Then let's get practicing. If you manage to keep up with me, I might just accept you as my peer!
Whoa, slow down! Ya think the world's ready for Ranzal, genius of the century?
Ha! It's finally your time to shine! Now let's get to it, old man.
